001package org.consensusj.bitcoinj.service;
002
003import org.bitcoinj.base.Address;
004import org.bitcoinj.base.Coin;
005import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
006import org.bitcoinj.core.InsufficientMoneyException;
007import org.bitcoinj.core.Transaction;
008import org.consensusj.bitcoinj.signing.SigningRequest;
009import org.consensusj.bitcoinj.signing.TransactionInputData;
010import org.consensusj.bitcoinj.signing.TransactionOutputData;
011import org.consensusj.bitcoinj.signing.TransactionSigner;
012
013import java.io.IOException;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
016
017/**
018 * A wallet-level service that can complete and sign transactions.
019 */
020public interface SignTransactionService extends TransactionSigner {
021
022    /**
023     * Create and sign a transaction to send coins to the specified address. Implements the transaction-building
024     * and signing portion of {@code sendtoaddress} RPC.
025     * @param toAddress destination address
026     * @param amount amount to send
027     * @return a future signed transaction
028     */
029    CompletableFuture<Transaction> signSendToAddress(Address toAddress, Coin amount) throws IOException, InsufficientMoneyException;
030
031    /**
032     * Create a signing request, given a list of inputs, a list of outputs and a change address. Calculates
033     * the fee, adds a change output, and returns a completed signing request.
034     * @param network network (shouldn't be needed, but is for now)
035     * @param inputUtxos list of available UTXOs
036     * @param outputs Outputs to send to
037     * @param changeAddress address that will receive change
038     * @return a completed transaction signing request
039     */
040    SigningRequest createBitcoinSigningRequest(Network network, List<TransactionInputData> inputUtxos, List<TransactionOutputData> outputs, Address changeAddress) throws InsufficientMoneyException;
041}
